content:
BBC News Summary

The news today covers a wide range of topics from politics, crime, social issues, to sports. The UK-EU treaty might require travelers to show their passport twice. A man convicted of murdering schoolgirls Holly Wells and Jessica Chapman is serving a life sentence. Safety campaigners criticize Meta's new feature for parents using Instagram's teen supervision tools. The issue of Greenland's potential annexation by Donald Trump is likely to dominate the election campaign. Bills to allow terminally ill people to end their life are being considered at Westminster and in Scotland. Former secretary of state recently agreed to appear, alongside her former president husband. The UK's weak job market is affecting people at the start of their careers. Rachel Duffy spoke publicly for the first time about winning The Traitors and then losing her mother. A distasteful joke by US President Donald Trump overshadowed the achievement of female athletes at the Winter Olympics. Ex-Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn's supporters won the majority of seats on Your Party's central executive committee. A pregnant woman needed an emergency C-section after a car accident. A ban on new holiday homes sees more permanent residents but some argue it harms tourism. Israeli forces blocked Palestinian ambulances while a 14-year-old lay bleeding. Dedicated parking bays have not completely solved the issue. There were 4,793 people sleeping on the streets on a single night last autumn. The importance of representation is highlighted in the hit Netflix show. The interim report has identified problems at every stage of the maternity journey in England. Lord Mandelson's lawyers said police arrested the peer because of a baseless suggestion he was planning to move abroad. The indirect negotiations in Geneva are seen as a last-ditch effort, but the chances of a nuclear agreement are unclear. The remains of 14-year-old Celeste Rivas Hernandez were found in the singer's car last year. Natalie McNally was killed in her Silverwood Green home in Lurgan on 18 December 2022. Water super-heated by rocks will also provide the UK's first domestic supply of the critical mineral lithium. The top Democrat on the congressional panel investigating Epstein has called on the attorney general to publish the material. The Metropolitan Police apologises to Commons Speaker for sharing Mandelson tip-off. A range of voices on the impact of the government's SEND reforms in England were heard. A radical new structure for English rugby is set to be rubber-stamped by the RFU, with the Prem separating from the rest of the pyramid, and promotion and relegation scrapped. Conor Benn's bout against Regis Prograis will be the co-main event to Tyson Fury's comeback fight against Arslanbek Makhmudov in April. Manchester United goalkeeper Senne Lammens says he is just a normal guy, but his reputation is growing after an impressive debut season at Old Trafford. Veteran promoter Frank Warren confirms he is considering legal action against Saudi Arabian-owned Sela and American company TKO. Real Madrid launch an investigation after a supporter allegedly performed a Nazi salute before the club's Champions League win against Benfica on Wednesday.
